intro: Dicera dentata, commonly known as the toothed dicera, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in a composite head that attracts pollinators. Dicera dentata is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
